intro: Muehlenbeckia leptobotrys, commonly known as the slender leaf muhlenbeckia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with thin, wiry stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in clusters and attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and forested areas.
